# Copilot Instructions for carloren-website

## Project Overview

This is a custom website project dedicated to showcasing the work and career of voice actor Carlos Lorenzo (Carloren). The website serves as a professional portfolio and information hub for the voice actor.

## Project Goals

- Create an engaging, professional portfolio website
- Showcase voice acting work, demos, and projects
- Provide contact information and booking details
- Maintain a clean, accessible, and performant web presence

## Development Guidelines

### Code Style

- Write clean, readable, and well-documented code
- Follow modern web development best practices
- Ensure accessibility (WCAG 2.1 AA compliance)
- Optimize for performance and fast loading times

### HTML/CSS

- Use semantic HTML5 elements
- Implement responsive design (mobile-first approach)
- Maintain consistent styling and spacing
- Use CSS custom properties for theming where applicable

### JavaScript

- Use modern ES6+ syntax
- Keep JavaScript modular and maintainable
- Minimize dependencies
- Ensure cross-browser compatibility

### Assets

- Optimize images for web (WebP format preferred with fallbacks)
- Use appropriate image sizes for different viewports
- Include alt text for all images
- Consider lazy loading for media content

### Accessibility

- Ensure proper semantic markup
- Include ARIA labels where necessary
- Maintain sufficient color contrast
- Support keyboard navigation
- Test with screen readers

### Performance

- Minimize HTTP requests
- Compress and minify assets
- Implement caching strategies
- Consider CDN usage for assets

## Content Guidelines

- Keep content focused on Carlos Lorenzo's voice acting career
- Use professional tone and language
- Ensure all content is accurate and up-to-date
- Respect copyright and intellectual property rights

## Testing

- Test across different browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge)
- Verify responsive behavior on various devices
- Check accessibility compliance
- Validate HTML and CSS

## Deployment Considerations

- Ensure all links work correctly
- Verify all assets load properly
- Test contact forms and interactive elements
- Check performance metrics (Lighthouse scores)

## Version Control

- Use meaningful commit messages
- Keep commits focused and atomic
- Create branches for new features
- Review changes before merging

## Support and Contact

For questions or issues related to this project, please refer to the repository's issue tracker or contact the project maintainer.
